title: Tomato Sauce, Sicilian Style
introduction: Experience the authentic flavors of Sicily with this Tomato Sauce made in the traditional Sicilian style. Rich and velvety, this sauce beautifully balances the tang of ripe tomatoes with the sweet, nutty notes of olive oil and butter. Ideal for drizzling over potato gnocchi or fresh fettuccine, this recipe brings the heart of Italy to your kitchen.
instructions: 1. If using a food mill to puree the tomatoes, cut them into quarters lengthwise and go to step 2. If using a food processor or blender, first peel the tomatoes: Bring a medium saucepan of water to boiling. Add the tomatoes a few at a time and cook 1 minute. With a slotted spoon, remove them and place in a bowl of cool water. Repeat with the remaining tomatoes. Peel the tomatoes, then core them and scrape out the seeds.
2. In a large pot, combine the tomatoes, onion, garlic, basil, and crushed red pepper. Cover and bring to a simmer. Cook over low heat 20 minutes or until the onion is tender. Let cool slightly.
3. Pass the mixture through a food mill, if using, or puree it in a blender or food processor. Return the puree to the pot. Add the basil, red pepper, and salt to taste.

4. Just before serving, reheat the sauce. Remove from the heat and stir in the olive oil and butter. Serve hot. Can be made ahead and stored in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator up to 5 days or in the freezer up to 2 months.
